the altitude at which the aircraft is capable of a climb rate of 500 feet per minute.

the greatest altitude at which more than one speed is available.

He has to decrease his speed.

no nosewheel steering and 7 kt of adverse crosswind.

variant.question: Assuming that the obstacle is 2 200 m from the end of TODA, the maximum semi-width of the obstacle domain for an aircraft of wingspan 52 m that can maintain navigational accuracy and is not required to turn more than 15° degrees after take-off is:
The approach climb requirement has been established to ensure:

options.text: minimum climb gradient in case of a go-around with one engine inoperative.
obstacle clearance in the approach area.
manoeuvrability in case of landing with one engine inoperative.
manoeuvrability during approach with full flaps and gear down, all engines operating.

variant.question:
Refer to figure 032-60.
An airplane is cruising in FL350, gross mass is 55 000 kg, Mach number is 0.74 and conditions are ISA. Find the level-off altitude in case of an engine failure...

Reference CAP 698 Fig 4.21 or annex.
Given the following data calculate the obstacle limited TOM?
Obstacle Height: 310 ft,
Distance: 22000 ft,
OAT: 35ºC,
PA: 2140 ft,
HW: 20 kts,
PMC OFF,
Flaps 15º.
